item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Players Can Unlock a Free Weapon Blueprint, But There's a Catch
item.description:
Summary

  • Activision enables Twitch Drops for Call of Duty: Warzone Season 3.
  • Warzone fans can unlock new rewards by watching participating Twitch streamers.
  • Viewers can redeem a double XP token at 2 hours, a double weapon XP token at 4 hours, and the Green Machine weapon blueprint for the XMG at 6 hours.

Activision has brought back Twitch Drops for Call of Duty: Warzone Season 3, allowing fans to earn free in-game rewards such as double XP tokens and a new weapon blueprint. The newest season of Call of Duty: Warzone kicked off on April 3 after some lengthy server downtime, bringing back the game's very first Battle Royale map as well as some iconic weapons from 2019's Modern Warfare .

While Season 3 of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 kicked off on April 2, Warzone fans were left waiting an extra 24 hours for the new season to begin as Activision took the game's servers offline in preparation for Verdansk's return. The beloved Battle Royale map has been absent for almost three and a half years, but Activision has finally brought Verdansk back with a fresh lick of paint. Although the map is still identical to its 2020 version, developer Beenox has rebuilt Verdansk from the ground up, featuring improved lighting, textures, and more complex and intricate foliage. Fans will also find more cover in areas of the map that were open, allowing for easier rotations between different points of interest.

To celebrate the return of Verdansk in Call of Duty: Warzone , Activision is once again enabling Twitch Drops with double XP tokens and a new weapon blueprint up for grabs. From April 3 until April 30, viewers can check out participating live streams to earn a double XP token, a double weapon XP token, and a new Green Machine weapon blueprint for the XMG. To obtain all of the new rewards up for grabs, players will need to watch a total of 6 hours of participating Warzone Twitch streams. After watching for 2 hours, players will be rewarded with a double XP token, followed by a double weapon XP token at 4 hours and a weapon blueprint at 6 hours.

How To Unlock Call of Duty: Warzone Season 3 Twitch Drops

  • Connect Activision and Twitch accounts via the Account Linking setting on your Call of Duty profile.
  • Visit a participating Warzone stream (most streamers will have "drops enabled" in their stream title).
  • Watch for two, four, or six hours to earn rewards.
  • Visit the "Drops and Rewards" section on your Twitch profile to claim the rewards.

Activision isn't just celebrating Verdansk's return with Twitch Drops either. Call of Duty: Warzone fans also have a new code to redeem via the Call of Duty website that will bag them a "Verdansk is back" Calling Card and 30 minutes of double weapon XP. Fans looking to redeem the rewards can simply visit callofduty.com/redeem, sign in, and enter the code: KYHPCVYSNP6HY. The free calling card and double weapon XP token will then be added to the player's account and ready to use in-game.

Alongside the return of Verdansk, Call of Duty: Warzone Season 3 also features a brand-new Battle Pass with plenty of new cosmetic items, weapon blueprints, operator skins, and more up for grabs. The Battle Pass also includes some returning weapons from the 2019 reboot of Modern Warfare , including the CR-56 AMAX, HDR Sniper Rifle, and the Grau 5.56 conversion kit for the SWAT 5.56. Fans can also obtain the iconic Kilo 141 by simply logging into Call of Duty: Warzone ​​​​​​. The weapon will be automatically added to the player's account upon sign-in.

item.title: Fans Think Pokemon TCG Pocket's New Event is 'Illegal'
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon TCG Pocket's new event may violate consumer laws due to lack of transparency.
  • Strict regulations in China require drop rates disclosure in gacha games like TCG Pocket.
  • Players criticize misleading instructions and RNG reliance in the Sneak Peek feature.

Fans of Pokemon TCG Pocket have pointed out that the Sneak Peek feature could be considered "illegal." They're referring to a new limited-time event introduced on April 3, suggesting that the lack of transparency around one specific detail could potentially violate consumer protection laws. This is not the first time a gacha game has faced accusations of legal violations; however, it may be the first instance of such allegations aimed at Pokemon TCG Pocket .

With the growing popularity of gacha games and their addictive nature, some regulators in regions like China and Europe have proposed specific consumer protection laws to safeguard players from gacha exploitation. One strict gaming regulation came from China, which mandated that all video game developers disclose the odds of loot boxes and random items. Since then, most gacha games, including Pokemon TCG Pocket , have published their drop rates and pity systems to help players understand what they're paying for. However, a group of TCG Pocket players now believe that the game's latest event may disregard these legal requirements.

Reddit user BigGreyCatOwner shared their concerns on the game's subreddit, claiming that the Wonder Pick's Sneak Peek campaign in TCG Pocket could be potentially illegal. They argue that since the feature requires spending Poke Gold to get Wonder Hourglasses, the developer should have disclosed the odds of receiving a "Sneak Peek." As it stands, the event appears to rely entirely on RNG, which could be considered against the law in certain regions and countries.

TCG Pocket's Sneak Peek Event Could Violate Some Laws

TCG Pocket's regular Wonder Picks let players choose one of five face-down cards that previously appeared in another player's booster pack. However, when the Sneak Peek feature is triggered, the first selected card is revealed without ending the Wonder Pick, allowing the player to make another selection if the first pick isn't desirable.

In the same Reddit thread, some fans highlighted another issue with the event: misleading instructions. According to them, the in-game text and pop-up prompts give a false impression that the player's current Wonder Pick includes a Sneak Peek chance. In reality, it doesn't, and players are sometimes forced to spend Wonder Stamina before realizing their pick isn't eligible for the feature. So far, The Pokemon Company and DeNA, the game's developers, haven't responded to these allegations or complaints. And with the ongoing backlash from the community, it's unclear whether the Sneak Peek feature will return in future Pokemon TCG Pocket events.

item.title: Black Ops 6: All Bell Locations in Shattered Veil
item.description:
The Bell is an important item in the Black Ops 6 Zombies map, Shattered Veil, for it's an essential part of the easter egg, but its spawns can be a tad confusing. The Bell is a tiny item found in one specific room, but it has so many spawns that it can be hard for some players to find it, so those in need can find all Bell locations in Shattered Veil, below.

To ensure that everyone has the easiest time finding the Bell in this Black Ops 6 Zombies map, all known locations have been listed below so that it's an easy find and that players can progress their quest with ease.

Where to Find the Bell in Shattered Veil

The Bell will only spawn in the Study, a room that can be found past the East Foyer, through the Library, and up the stairs before entering the room with Elemental Pop (where the SWAT 5.56 wall-buy is located). It's important to know that this is the Bell room, and the Bell cannot spawn outside of this room. If players are having a hard time finding the Bell, then try a few steps before searching again, like:

  • Ensure that someone on the team has a Ray Gun Mark 2
  • Pick up the Sconce from the Banquet Hall
  • Acquire any of the Empty Canisters

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #1

One of the first places the Bell can spawn is inside a cabinet next to a ceramic plate. This cabinet is at the south wall of the Study, beside a veiled statue.

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #2

Another potential spawn point for the Bell within the Study could be between the veiled statues and the two TV monitors when facing the south wall, on the floor.

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #3

Look to the ground on the south wall, where, to the left of the red display case and beside the fallen torso of a marble statue, players might be able to find a Bell spawn.

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #4

Another potential spawn for the Bell is within the bottom shelf to the right of the SWAT 5.56 wall-buy, where players will need to smash the glass in the cabinet to interact with the Bell to pick it up.

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #5

Yet another Bell spawn can be found on the north wall where the desk is located, with two computers and an axe.

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #6

This Bell is located on the bloodied floor below the SWAT 5.56 wall-buy, next to a shattered plate and a toppled over wooden step.

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #7

To the right of the SWAT 5.56 wall-buy, players can find yet another spawn for the Bell in the same cabinet as a ceramic plate, just behind a wooden ladder that blocks the path.

Bell Location in Shattered Veil #8

​​​​​​​Just to the left of the desk with two computers is another shelf, where behind the glass in the bottom cabinets will be a potential spawn for the Bell.

If players are still having trouble locating the Bell, then try and throw some grenades to blow up the display cases, and then walk around the edges of the room spamming the interact button until the prompt: Quest item retrieved BELL pops in the top right of the screen.

item.title: The Life, Death, and Legacy of Assassin’s Creed’s Connor Kenway
item.description:
On April 4, 1756, 269 years ago, a half-British, half-Mohawk named Ratonhnhake:ton was born, but for most Assassin’s Creed fans and members of the Assassin Brotherhood, this man was better known as Connor Kenway. In 2012, Connor was introduced to players as the fourth major protagonist in the mainline Assassin’s Creed franchise after Desmond Miles, Altair Ibn-La'Ahad, and Ezio Auditore da Firenze, and the final ancestor Miles would relive the memories of before his death. First appearing in Assassin’s Creed 3 , Connor would go on to become one of the most popular characters in the franchise, appearing in two other games. With many players revisiting Connor’s story in response to A ssassin’s Creed Shadows , here’s an in-depth look at Connor’s life, death, and legacy for the franchise.

The Complicated Family of Connor Kenway

When gamers first delved into Assassin’s Creed 3 , most were already aware of Connor’s rich family tree, with 18th century man being a descendant of the legendary Assassins Altair Ibn-La'Ahad and Ezio Auditore da Firenze, as well as the ancestor of William and Desmond miles. However, fans were quickly shocked to learn just how complicated and tragic Connor’s immediate family history was. Connor is not the first character gamers play in the 18th century. Instead, the first three sequences of the game have players embody Connor’s father, Haytham Kenway, who is revealed to be the Grand Master of the Colonial Rite of the Templar Order, the Assassin Brotherhood’s archenemies. This was the first time gamers got to play as a Templar in Assassin’s Creed ’s main campaign.

Tasked with establishing a Templar presence in the British colonies, opening the Isu Grand Temple, and eliminating the Colonial Assassin Brotherhood, Haytham would eventually encounter the Mohawk warrior Kaniehti꞉io, otherwise known as Ziio, in 1754. Together, Haytham and Ziio thwarted the British's efforts to encroach on Mohawk territory and assassinated General Edward Braddock in 1755 during the French and Indian War.

During these events, the two would briefly enter a romantic relationship together, with Haytham unknowingly fathering Connor before leaving to expand Templar control and continue destroying the Colonial Assassin Brotherhood. Ziio remained in colonial New England and raised Connor alone in a small Mohawk village until 1760, when she was killed by a British attack on the settlement.

Connor’s Discovery of his Assassin and Templar Lineage

Orphaned at the age of four, Connor is raised by his remaining members of the village, swearing to avenge his mother’s death. In 1769, Connor is sent to seek out the disgraced Mentor of the Assassin Colonial Brotherhood Achilles Davenport, to become an Assassin. Reluctantly, Davenport successfully trains Connor and aids him in eliminating Templar leaders within both the British Empire and the American Patriots during the Revolutionary War. It’s during Connor’s time with Davenport that he discovers who his father is, as well as his paternal grandfather, the legendary early 18th-century British Assassin Edward Kenway. By 1778, Connor and Haytham would encounter each other numerous times, with the two attempting to convert each other to their causes. Eventually, Connor was forced to assassinate his father to stop him from dominating the colonies.

Connor Kenway’s Life and Impact on Colonial America

Beyond Connor’s familial struggles and quest to defeat the Templars and free the people of North America, the Colonial Assassin repeatedly proves himself to be a selfless, resourceful, and skilled warrior. While training under Davenport, Connor discovers a deteriorating ship in the bay of the Davenport Homestead. With the help of Captain Robert Faulkner, Connor is able to restore the Aquila and uses it to support Patriots and colonists, trade supplies, and combat Templar naval forces. The Aquila additionally helps Connor reconnect with scattered remnants of the Colonial Assassin Brotherhood such as the Louisiana-based Assassin Aveline de Grandpre as seen in Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation .

Connor himself spearheads the reconstruction of the Colonial Brotherhood by helping downtrodden colonists and training them to become Assassins, such as:

  • Deborah Carter
  • Stephane Chapheau
  • Jamie Colley
  • Duncan Little
  • Clipper Wilkinson
  • Jacob Zenger

By the end of the Revolutionary War, Connor had successfully rooted out most Templar control within the young United States of America and had begun supporting other Assassins, such as those in the Parisian Brotherhood. Not every person Connor aided helped the Assassins, however. Throughout Assassin’s Creed 3 , players could take part in Homestead missions, which had Connor rebuild the Davenport Homestead, help struggling colonists, and invite them to live on the estate. Connor further helped shape the young United States by directly helping several Founding Fathers, such as George Washington and the Sons of Liberty, as seen in Assassin’s Creed Nexus VR .

The Death and Legacy of Connor Kenway

After the defeat of the Colonial Rite of the Templar Order with the deaths of Haytham Kenway and Charles Lee, little is known about Connor’s later life. In Assassin's Creed 3 , Connor’s village is shown to have fled after the United States seized and sold their land. Despite this event, Connor still kept in touch with many leaders in the United States, such as when he helped free Washington from nightmares caused by an Apple of Eden in The Tyranny of King Washington DLC. Connor continued to help rebuild the Colonial Brotherhood, serving as its new leader, even requesting Grandpre to help recruit the former slave, Patience Gibbs, in Rhode Island in 1784.

Connor makes no other game appearances following the end of Assassin’s Creed 4: Black Flag ’s Aveline DLC, but some of his later life is depicted in books and graphic novels. In the novel Assassin’s Creed: Forsaken , Connor reads through Haytham’s journal to learn more about his father’s early life and what Haytham truly thought of his son. In the comic Assassin's Creed: Reflections , it is revealed Connor eventually joined another tribe and married a currently unknown woman. Together they had three daughters, but only one, Io:nhiote, possessed the Eagle Vision ability present in the Miles family line. Due to this ability, it’s presumed Io:nhiote is Desmond Miles’ direct ancestor after Connor.

Connor Kenway’s Legacy in the Assassin’s Creed Franchise

It’s currently unknown when exactly Connor Kenway died in the Assassin’s Creed timeline, but his impact and legacy on the franchise can forever be felt. Without Connor, the modern-day Assassins may never have existed, and the Templars could have dominated the entire US, if not the world. Connor’s actions paved the way not just for an improved generation of Assassins but for Desmond Miles to save the world from catastrophe in 2012. He was additionally the first major Native American protagonist portrayed in the Assassin’s Creed franchise, paving the way for more diverse characters and narratives to be featured in later games. While Connor’s story may have been divisive at launch, he’s gone on to become more accepted by fans for his rich, complex, story and groundbreaking naval gameplay.

item.title: Monopoly GO: How To Get Champ Token
item.description:
Scopely loves giving Monopoly GO players exciting new ways to personalize their game boards. This time around, you can snag the limited-edition Champ board token. Like other tokens in Monopoly GO , the Champ token won’t give you any special abilities, but this exclusive token will look fantastic on your shelves. Keep reading to find out how you can get the Champ token in Monopoly GO .

How To Get Champ Token in Monopoly GO

The Champ board token captures the excitement of reaching the finish line in first position. It features a lively racer, beaming with happiness as he poses in celebration. In his right hand, he proudly carries a golden trophy which bears the letter M.

The Champ token is a limited-edition board token awarded as a top prize in the ongoing City Racers event in Monopoly GO . This event went live on April 02, 2025, and will run for five days before wrapping up on April 06, 2025. It is the first-place reward for both individual players or those playing in a team of four.

In addition to the token, winners will receive other valuable rewards like Wild Stickers (allowing you to get any missing sticker), new emojis related to racing, and high-value sticker packs (Purple, Blue, or Pink, depending on whether you played solo or in a team).

How To Play City Racers in Monopoly GO

City Racers follows the same format of traditional Tycoon Racers events, where your goal is to collect the most number of medals across three intense races. Whether you’re playing in a team or all by yourself, you’ll need to collect Flag tokens to move your racers around the board.

You can get Flags by participating in different activities like solo events, leaderboard tournaments, completing daily "Quick Wins," claiming free shop rewards, and landing on special tiles on the board. The end goal of City Racers is to score the most points in each race and collect the most medals by the end of the event.

In addition to the Lucky Rocket in Monopoly GO , Scopely has released another flash booster named Ball & Chain. This booster allows you to pick a competing team and slow them down. As soon as you use it, the targeted team is slowed down for a while, and needs to earn a set number of points to shake off the effect. This gives you or your team some breathing room in the races, allowing you to outrun the competition. It's a powerful tool that increases your chances of crossing the finish line first and claiming those top-tier rewards in the City Racers event.
